channel.title: Copyright Infringment Email
channel.description: Well I just checked my email today and I see I recieved a copyright infringment email from charter telling me that I download adobe cs4 dmg file. This suprised me because I downloaded it and I immediatley stopped the torrent. It gave me a link and I had to choose that I deleted the file (which I did because I dont use osx anymore) or click that it was a mistake which I didn't choose because I didn't want to get into it with charter. Have any of you guys recieved copyright infringment emails and if so what did you do? Should I be worried?

item.title: Copyright Infringment Email
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

well, they have to give a shit

they lose immunity if they dont act on DMCAs they know are valid

item.title: Copyright Infringment Email
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

mwiebelhaus:

Mopmap is right its not like ISP’s give a shit what your doing as long as they get your money unless companies are pulling DMCA shit on them telling them to do something then they will do it.

Hence, they give a shit.

what i do is root a box and then use ssh tunneling

i buy a $10 vps with my pp.

item.title: Copyright Infringment Email
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

inertia:

Wouldn’t that be seriously slow? And what are hosting companies policies like on this sort of thing?

Rooted boxes could be a home user; you’d get rates of about 150Kb/s on an average cable line. Or it could be sitting on a real dedicated line. Speeds are relevant.

inertia:

And what are hosting companies policies like on this sort of thing?

Depends on the company (if you’re doing it the nice way ;)).

Read full topic

item.title: Copyright Infringment Email
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

inertia:

Wouldn’t that be seriously slow?

Depends how fast the rooted box is…If it’s in a dc with 100mbits up/down it should be quite fast.

Read full topic

item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:48, topic:306123”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=402307.msg2982819#msg2982819 date=1254709160]
what i do is root a box and then use ssh tunneling
[/quote]

For VPS?[/quote]
He means he gains privileged access to a machine and tunnels BitTorrent traffic over SOCKS5 (ssh tunnel).

item.title: Copyright Infringment Email
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Unhandled:

That is unlikely to work due to max_execution_time on shared servers usually being 15-30 seconds. I dunno about perl though.

I think the php uses python too but then again I don’t know that many webhosting services that have python enabled…wouldn’t make much sense to have it anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: Copyright Infringment Email
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

That is unlikely to work due to max_execution_time on shared servers usually being 15-30 seconds. I dunno about perl though.

Read full topic

item.title: Copyright Infringment Email
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Tell me if this is even possible may not even make sense.

Use basic webhosting from some company such as hostgator.

Use a php bittorrent client such as TorrentFlux to download the files to the servers then after they are downloaded their you download them to yourself via SSH or HTTP or FTP.

or

Use a perl bittorrent client such as Bitflu (not sure this will work) then do what was previously stated.

Read full topic

item.title: Copyright Infringment Email
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:42, topic:306123”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=402307.msg2982709#msg2982709 date=1254702166]

I don’t know. But for you guys who say you have like 10 isps to choose from do you live in the US?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 04, 2009, 06:05:28 pm[/size][hr]This is starting to piss me off, my internet has been intermittently going on and off for the last 2 days and I can connect to my neighbors unsecured network and everything is fucking grand and he has the same service. What do you guys think is going on? I have all bittorrent clients uninstalled for now.

If they were cutting you off, you’d have 0 connectivity not intervals of downtime.

Alright

An option is buying a machine (VPS/Dedicated/VPN) and using that as a proxy.
[/quote]

That sounds like a really good idea, but do you know of any cheap ones they all seem a little high priced.[/quote]
VPN/VPS services can be as little as $10/mo. Xygenhosting, VPSLand, LimestoneNetworks, etc.

Read full topic
